snippet: The prosecutor rejected a claim of self-defense in the shooting death of a young black Detroit woman by a white suburban homeowner.
abstract: Detroit prosecutor charges Theodore P Wafer with second-degree murder in killing of Renisha Marie McBride; rejects Wafer's assertion that he had been acting in self-defense when he opened his front door and fired a shotgun at the woman through a locked screen door; shooting has ignited anguished conversation in the largely black city about why another unarmed black person has been killed and whether anyone would be called to account.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago, and Susan C. Beachy from New York.

lead_paragraph: The prosecutor rejected a claim of self-defense in the shooting death of a young black Detroit woman by a white suburban homeowner.

headline.main: Murder Charge in a Shooting on Doorstep
headline.print_headline: Murder Charge In a Case Tied To Race Issues
